questions.title: How to sort an array in JavaScript?
questions.description: I have an array of objects and I want to sort it based on a property of the objects. How can I do that?

answers.text: You can use the `sort()` method of the array and pass in a comparison function that compares the values based on the property you want to sort on.

Another approach is to use the `map()` method to extract the property you want to sort on, then use the `sort()` method on the resulting array, and finally use the `map()` method again to transform the sorted array back to the original format.

questions.title: What is the difference between `var`, `let`, and `const` in JavaScript?
questions.description: I am confused about the different ways to declare variables in JavaScript. What are the differences between `var`, `let`, and `const`?

answers.text: `var` is function-scoped, `let` and `const` are block-scoped. `let` can be reassigned, `const` cannot. Use `let` when you need to reassign the variable, use `const` otherwise.
